channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report X-2023120293
item.description:
Report X-2023120293

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: tHE PACKAGE WAS LOCATED UPSIDE DOWN. tHIS CAUSED PRESSURE ON THE LID SEAL AND HALF THE CONTENTS LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OTHER 3 BOTTLES. package was turned upright and placed in a hazmat bag and drum. DescribePack: Lid seal was opened due to package being placed upside down. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was turned upright and placed in Hazmat drum and bag.

item.title: Report X-2023120515
item.description:
Report X-2023120515

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: FORT SMITH
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FSMA spill agent was called to the sort input for a fiberboard box with signs of a release. The spill agent was told that the fiberboard box was dropped during the unloading process. While investigating the shipment the agent observed that the source of the release came from between the release valve and the cylinder. The fire extinguisher was packaged with molded styrofoam on top and bottom inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were released from the extinguisher and gauge of the release valve reads as empty. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package.

item.title: Report X-2023120448
item.description:
Report X-2023120448

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At 5am, a package handler brought over a hazmat suspected of leaking to the QA area from the unload area. The package handler found it upside down in the trailer. Once it was brought to QA, we segregated it from other packages to prevent further damage to other packages. DescribePack: Package was found upside down. Wet spot is on top of the box, which is consistent with a package being upside down. Cap was only slightly loose on the jug that leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was segregated from other packages and people to minimize risk of damage to packages, and harm to workers.

  • Description: Car was sent over the hump and had an overspeed due to that resulted in a hard couple, rupturing the disc. The disc was blown and replaced in kind by UP Hazmat Manager. The car was neutralized and wiped clean and held for wheel inspection.

item.title: Report E-2023120108
item.description:
Report E-2023120108

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: SPRINGDALE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a one-gallon spill of UN1814 "ConvoClean Forte" was damaged at Terminal LSD. (2) 2.5-gallon plastic jugs were damaged during transit as a result of not being properly secured after being refused by the customer impacting the trailer. (1) 10-gallon poly drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material. damaged plastic jugs, the remaining material, and issued PPE was created as waste and left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023120145
item.description:
Report X-2023120145

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-27
  • City: MABELVALE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found leaking inside the back of the van as a result of the drum had a punctured at the bottom which lead the contents to leaked out and a safe procedure was taking to reduce the leakage by putting the drum in hazmat bag. DescribePack: There was a puncture at the bottom of the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Safe procedure (protective groves, hazmat bags) was used to reduce the leakage by putting the drum in hazmat bag.

item.title: Report E-2023120061
item.description:
Report E-2023120061

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: SPRINGDALE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSD experienced a UN3109 Microtox Ultra release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 3’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 55-gallon vented poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110753
item.description:
Report X-2023110753

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: TEXARKANA
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was dropped while being unloaded causing leak. Package was placed into a lined tote for containment. DescribePack: Metal can was punctured on bottom near edge. 2/3 inch opening. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed into a lined plastic tote and moved aways from spill area.
